      • replaceForEach

        public static java.lang.String replaceForEach(java.lang.String s,
                                              java.lang.String what,
                                              java.util.function.Supplier<java.lang.String> f)
        This method is used as a changing replaceAll for strings.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to modify
        what - What to replace
        f - The supplier that supplies the replacement
        Returns:
        The modified string

      • compile

        public static boolean compile(java.lang.String java,
                              java.io.File f)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        This method writes the file with the given content and tries to compile it.
        Parameters:
        java - The java code to compile
        f - The file to use for compilation (must be named after the public class from the string)
        Returns:
        True if the compilation was successful
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the temporary file could not be created or written
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If no java compiler was found
        See Also:
        compile(File)

      • compile

        public static boolean compile(java.io.File f)
        This method is used to compile a java file.
        Parameters:
        f - The file to compile
        Returns:
        True if the compilation was successful
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If no java compiler was found

      • loadClass

        public static java.lang.Object loadClass(java.io.File root,
                                         java.lang.String className)
                                  throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                         java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                         java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        This method is used to load classes at runtime.
        Parameters:
        root - The root folder in which the class if in
        className - The full class name including the package name
        Returns:
        An instance of the newly loaded class
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - If the root file cannot be turned into an URL
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the given class could not be found
        java.lang.InstantiationException - If the class could not be instantiated
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If the classes constructor could not be accessed

      • getCompiler

        public static javax.tools.JavaCompiler getCompiler()
        This method tries to find a Java compiler.
        Returns:
        An instance of JavaCompiler or null if no compiler could be found

      • getFromURL

        public static java.lang.String getFromURL(java.lang.String url)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method can be used to get the contents of an file by its URL location.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL to locate the file
        Returns:
        A string containing the contents of the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file could not be found or read from

      • switchComplex

        public static <T,U extends T,R> SwitchNode<T,U,R> switchComplex(T input,
                                                                java.util.function.BiFunction<T,U,java.lang.Boolean> compare)
        This method can be used to perform complex switch/case statements.
        Type Parameters:
        T - This is the type of the value to 'switch'
        U - This is the type of the value(s) to compare to ('case')
        R - This is the type if the value this 'switch' statement returns
        Parameters:
        input - The value to 'switch'
        compare - The function to use for comparison
        Returns:
        The value that results from any match or an IllegalArgumentException if no case compares to true

      • switchRegex

        public static <R> SwitchNode<java.lang.String,java.lang.String,R> switchRegex(java.lang.String input)
        This method can be used to compare strings with regular expressions using a switch/case-like structure.
        Type Parameters:
        R - This is the type if the value this 'switch' statement returns
        Parameters:
        input - The value to 'switch'
        Returns:
        The value that results from any match or an IllegalArgumentException if no case compares to true
